questions.question_text: Which of the following is a C4 plant?
questions.solution: C4 plants such as maize have Kranz anatomy and PEP carboxylase enzyme.

questions.question_text: In which part of the root does most absorption of water occur?
questions.solution: Root hairs increase absorptive surface area, allowing maximum water uptake.

questions.question_text: Which plant hormone delays leaf senescence?
questions.solution: Cytokinins promote cell division and delay aging processes.

questions.question_text: Double fertilisation in angiosperms involves fusion of:
options: One male gamete with egg and another with polar nuclei
Two male gametes with two eggs
questions.correct_answer: One male gamete with egg and another with polar nuclei
questions.solution: Double fertilisation forms zygote and triploid endosperm.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of a symbiotic nitrogen-fixing bacterium?
questions.solution: Rhizobium lives in root nodules of legumes and fixes nitrogen.

questions.question_text: Which tissue is responsible for the secondary growth of plants?
questions.solution: Vascular cambium produces secondary xylem and phloem.

questions.question_text: Which structure in chloroplast contains the photosystems?
questions.solution: Thylakoids house PS-II and PS-I used in light reactions.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a micronutrient?
questions.solution: Micronutrients are required in small amounts. Fe is essential for chlorophyll synthesis.

questions.question_text: Which plant division lacks vascular tissues?
questions.solution: Bryophytes are non-vascular plants and require water for fertilisation.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a xerophyte adaptation?
questions.solution: Xerophytes reduce transpiration using sunken stomata and thick cuticle.

questions.question_text: During photorespiration, which organelle is NOT directly involved?
questions.solution: Photorespiration occurs across chloroplast, peroxisome, and mitochondria.

questions.question_text: Casparian strips are found in:
questions.solution: Suberin-rich Casparian strips control entry of substances into xylem.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of apomixis?
options: Fusion of male and female gametes
questions.solution: Apomixis forms seeds without meiosis and fertilisation.

questions.question_text: Which RNA acts as an adapter molecule during protein synthesis?
questions.solution: tRNA carries amino acids to ribosome during translation.

questions.question_text: Which plant exhibits CAM photosynthesis?
questions.solution: CAM plants open stomata at night to minimise water loss.

questions.question_text: Which is a non-reducing sugar?
questions.solution: Sucrose lacks a free aldehydic or ketonic group.

questions.question_text: Which plant tissue is dead at maturity?
questions.solution: Xylem conducts water and is made up of dead lignified cells.

questions.question_text: Which is the longest phase of the cell cycle?
questions.solution: Interphase includes G1, S, G2 phases, longest in duration.

questions.question_text: Where does glycolysis occur?
questions.solution: Glycolysis occurs in cytosol and produces pyruvate.

questions.question_text: Which polymer is present in plant cell walls?
questions.solution: Cellulose is a β-1,4-linked polysaccharide forming plant cell wall.

questions.question_text: Which organism reproduces via fragmentation?
questions.solution: Filamentous algae like Spirogyra break into fragments that grow.

questions.question_text: Which is an example of an insect-pollinated flower?
questions.solution: Bright coloured flowers attract insects for pollination.

questions.question_text: Which plant hormone promotes seed dormancy?
questions.solution: ABA induces dormancy and inhibits germination.

questions.question_text: Which part of the ovule develops into the seed coat?
questions.solution: Integuments harden to form seed coat.

questions.question_text: Which structure stores food in monocot seeds?
questions.solution: Monocots have large endosperm for nutrition.

questions.question_text: Which pigment is essential for photoperiodism?
questions.solution: Phytochrome detects red and far-red light controlling flowering.

questions.question_text: Which enzyme is responsible for CO2 fixation in Calvin cycle?
questions.solution: RuBisCO catalyses carboxylation of RuBP.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT an example of a parasitic plant?
questions.solution: Hydrilla is an autotrophic aquatic plant.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of water-pollinated plant?
questions.solution: Vallisneria shows hydrophily (water pollination).

questions.question_text: Which structure transports sugars in plants?
questions.solution: Phloem transports sucrose through pressure-flow mechanism.

questions.question_text: Which of the following has a true coelom?
questions.solution: Annelids (earthworms) possess a true coelom lined by mesoderm.

questions.question_text: Which protein is present in human hair and nails?
questions.solution: Keratin is a structural protein forming hair, nails, feathers.

questions.question_text: Which gland secretes melatonin?
questions.solution: Melatonin regulates circadian rhythms.

questions.question_text: Which blood group is known as universal donor?
questions.solution: O− lacks A, B and Rh antigens, so compatible with all recipients.

questions.question_text: Which organelle is responsible for ATP production?
questions.solution: Mitochondria are the powerhouse of the cell.

questions.question_text: Which disorder is caused by the absence of clotting factor VIII?
questions.solution: Haemophilia A is X-linked and due to deficiency of factor VIII.

questions.question_text: Which of the following prevents backflow of blood?
questions.solution: Valves in heart ensure unidirectional blood flow.

questions.question_text: Which part of the brain controls respiration?
questions.solution: Medulla regulates involuntary functions like breathing.

questions.question_text: Which is the primary site of protein digestion?
questions.solution: Pepsin in stomach begins protein digestion.

questions.question_text: Which cells produce antibodies?
questions.solution: B cells differentiate into plasma cells that secrete antibodies.

questions.question_text: Which part of the nephron is mainly responsible for selective reabsorption?
questions.solution: PCT reabsorbs glucose, amino acids, ions and water.

questions.question_text: Which hormone controls BMR (basal metabolic rate)?
questions.solution: Thyroxine increases metabolic rate and oxygen consumption.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of exoskeleton?
questions.solution: Arthropods have external skeleton made of chitin.

questions.question_text: Which vitamin deficiency causes night blindness?
questions.solution: Vitamin A is required for formation of visual pigment rhodopsin.

questions.question_text: Which is a vector-borne disease?
questions.solution: Malaria is transmitted by female Anopheles mosquito.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the structural and functional unit of nervous system?
questions.solution: Neurons conduct impulses, forming basic neural circuits.

questions.question_text: Which blood vessel carries oxygen-rich blood from lungs to heart?
questions.solution: Pulmonary veins carry oxygenated blood from lungs to left atrium.

questions.question_text: The functional unit of the liver is called:
questions.solution: Liver lobules are hexagonal functional units.

questions.question_text: Which hormone regulates blood calcium levels?
questions.solution: PTH increases blood Ca2+ by bone resorption and kidney reabsorption.

questions.question_text: Which muscle is involuntary and striated?
questions.solution: Cardiac muscle is involuntary but has striations.

questions.question_text: Which part of the brain controls hunger and thirst?
questions.solution: Hypothalamus regulates temperature, hunger, thirst, and emotions.

questions.question_text: Which organism is the cause of AIDS?
questions.solution: HIV attacks CD4+ T cells leading to AIDS.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT an accessory digestive gland?
questions.solution: Spleen belongs to lymphatic system, not digestive.

questions.question_text: Which organ stores bile?
questions.solution: Gall bladder stores bile produced by liver.

questions.question_text: Which hormone stimulates ovulation?
questions.solution: LH surge triggers ovulation.

questions.question_text: Which process forms haploid gametes?
questions.solution: Meiosis reduces chromosome number to form haploid gametes.

questions.question_text: Which immunoglobulin is found in colostrum?
questions.solution: IgA provides passive immunity to infants.

questions.question_text: Which is the functional unit of the kidney?
questions.solution: Nephron filters blood and forms urine.

questions.question_text: Which blood component helps in clotting?
questions.solution: Platelets release thromboplastin initiating clotting.

questions.question_text: Which type of joint is found between atlas and axis?
questions.solution: Pivot joint allows rotation of head.

questions.question_text: Which of the following carries genetic information?
questions.solution: DNA stores hereditary information.

questions.question_text: Which tissue transports water in animals?
questions.solution: Blood transports water, nutrients, and gases.

questions.question_text: Which vitamin is produced in the skin upon sunlight exposure?
questions.solution: UV light converts cholesterol into Vitamin D.

questions.question_text: The exchange of gases in lungs occurs through:
questions.solution: Alveoli have thin walls and large surface area for gas exchange.

questions.question_text: Which gland secretes insulin?
questions.solution: Beta cells of pancreas release insulin.

questions.question_text: Which structure conducts impulses away from the neuron cell body?
questions.solution: Axons carry impulses away from soma to terminals.

questions.question_text: Which enzyme digests starch?
questions.solution: Amylase breaks starch to maltose.

questions.question_text: Which hormone causes milk ejection in mothers?
questions.solution: Oxytocin contracts mammary ducts causing milk let-down.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a sexually transmitted infection?
questions.solution: Gonorrhea is caused by Neisseria gonorrhoeae.

questions.question_text: Which structure in sperm contains enzymes for penetrating the egg?
questions.solution: Acrosome has hydrolytic enzymes for fertilisation.

questions.question_text: Which blood vessel carries blood from digestive organs to liver?
questions.solution: Portal vein transports nutrient-rich blood to liver.

questions.question_text: Which part of the ear helps in maintaining body balance?
questions.solution: They detect rotational movement and help balance.

questions.question_text: Which phenotype is expressed in heterozygote for complete dominance?
questions.solution: Dominant allele masks recessive expression.

questions.question_text: Which disease is associated with insulin deficiency?
questions.solution: Low insulin prevents glucose uptake.

questions.question_text: Which organism is used in bakery and alcohol industries?
questions.solution: Yeast ferments sugars to ethanol and CO2.

questions.question_text: Which chromosome carries the gene for haemophilia?
questions.solution: Haemophilia is X-linked recessive.

questions.question_text: Which organ secretes bile?
questions.solution: Liver produces bile; gall bladder stores it.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT a connective tissue?
questions.solution: Nervous tissue transmits impulses; not connective.

questions.question_text: Which structure produces sperm in humans?
questions.solution: Spermatogenesis occurs in seminiferous tubules.

questions.question_text: Which organ is affected in jaundice?
questions.solution: Bilirubin accumulation causes jaundice.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the largest organ in the human body?
questions.solution: Skin covers the entire body and provides protection.

questions.question_text: Which enzyme breaks down lactose?
questions.solution: Lactase splits lactose into glucose and galactose.

questions.question_text: Which organ regulates osmoregulation?
questions.solution: Kidney balances salts and water.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a primary lymphoid organ?
questions.solution: T-lymphocytes mature in thymus.

questions.question_text: Which neurons carry impulses from CNS to muscle?
questions.solution: Motor neurons send signals from brain/spinal cord to effectors.

questions.question_text: Which hormone is known as the ‘fight or flight’ hormone?
questions.solution: Adrenaline increases heart rate and prepares body for emergency.

questions.question_text: Which part of the female reproductive system is the site of fertilisation?
questions.solution: Fertilisation occurs in ampulla region of fallopian tube.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of passive immunity?
questions.solution: Maternal antibodies give temporary passive immunity.

questions.question_text: Which biomolecule provides highest energy per gram?
questions.solution: Lipids provide ~9 kcal/g, highest among biomolecules.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is responsible for maintaining posture and balance?
questions.solution: Cerebellum coordinates voluntary movements and balance.
